Awesome! I'll definitely look into those Welsh language courses for adults. Do you have any tips for someone just starting out on learning Welsh?

Yes, here are some tips for someone just starting out on learning Welsh:

1. Start with the basics: Begin with the basics of the Welsh language, such as pronunciation, basic vocabulary, and grammar.

2. Use a variety of resources: Make use of online courses, books, apps, podcasts, and other resources to help you learn Welsh. There are many resources available that cater to different learning styles.

3. Practice, practice, practice: Practice speaking, reading, writing, and listening to Welsh as much as possible. This will help you become comfortable with the language and build your confidence.

4. Join a language exchange group: Join a language exchange group or find a Welsh-speaking partner to practice your skills with. Speaking with native speakers is one of the best ways to learn a language and perfect your pronunciation.

5. Immerse yourself in Welsh culture: Immerse yourself in Welsh culture by attending Welsh language events, festivals, and concerts. This will help you to get a better understanding and appreciation of the Welsh culture and people.

6. Be patient: Learning a new language takes time, effort, and patience. Don't get discouraged if you don't progress as quickly as you would like. With dedication and consistency, you'll see progress over time.
